titles.title: Columbia Orbiter Memorial Act
Columbia Orbiter Memorial Act
Columbia Orbiter Memorial Act
A bill to require the construction at Arlington National Cemetery of a memorial to the crew of the Columbia Orbiter.

action.text: Introduced in the Senate and read twice and ordered held at desk. until the close of business March 19, 2003.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

Referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs, and in addition to the Committee on Science, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

bill.summary: (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced in the Senate on March 13, 2003. The summary of that version is repeated here.)Columbia Orbiter Memorial Act - Directs the Secretary of the Army to construct in Arlington National Cemetery, Virginia, a memorial marker honoring the seven members of the crew of the Columbia Orbiter who died on February 1, 2003, during the landing of space shuttle mission STS-107.Authorizes the Administrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration to: (1) accept gifts and donations for that or another memorial or monument to the crew; and (2) transfer any donations accepted for the Arlington National Cemetery memorial.
